channel.title: Andrea Vanags' SDS 348 Website
channel.description: Recent content on Andrea Vanags' SDS 348 Website

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Andrea Vanags (av29824) Introduction: The two datasets I have chosen for this project contain information about suicides and earthquakes worldwide from 1985 to 2016. The suicides dataset contains qualitative (ex: sex, age, generation, countries) and quantitative data (ex: year, number of suicides, country population, gdp for year and per capita). The earthquakes dataset countains mostly quantitative values (ex:date, longitude, latitude, depth, magnitude), some qualitative (ex: ID, status, type) and quite a few N/As.

item.title: project 2
item.description: 0. Introduce your dataset and each of your variables in a paragraph. What are they measuring? How many observations? The 'HealthInsurance' dataset including info from the the Medical Expenditure Panel Survey conducted in 1996 was recovered from the AER package. This dataset contains 8,802 observations on 11 variables, but the variables I will be focusing on are: age, gender, education, family, ethnicity, married, insurance, and health. The wrangled dataset was renamed as 'data2' and it contains 1,258 rows (observations) for 8 columns.

item.title: Reticulate: The Real Mind Meld
item.description: On the wrong page? Maybe you're looking for my first project? Click below! Link to project 1 Still here?? Nice. Let's look at how we can use R and Python together without wanting to tear your hair out in frustration: reticulate. #R-code chunk library(reticulate) lookalike <- "who is dr. woodward's celebrity look-alike?" #python code chunk one= "brian david gilbert" two= "and mathew gray gubler" #access R-defined objects with r. print(r.

item.title: Resume
item.description: One day I'll create a resume full of my un-marketable skills such as my ability to sing perfectly along to a swedish club song, or my amazing inability to touch my toes, but today is not that day. Instead, enjoy a listing of my marketable skills and academic achievements:
